diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Partial growth hormone insensitivity due to GH-R77C mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the presence of a heterozygous R77C transition mutation in the GH-1 gene, which correlated with short stature and partial GH insensitivity in the affected patient and his family members. Clinical findings included elevated GH levels, low IGF-I levels, and a history of delayed growth and pubertal development.
